metadata.dc:author: Viscasillas, Guillem
Maiz, Javier
Sanz, Juan José
Zschaeck, Christiane
Lao, Xavier
metadata.dc:description: Oncogenic osteomalacia is an uncommon syndrome characterized by phosphaturic tumours that produce mineral metabolism abnormalities. Head and neck is the second most frequent location of these tumours. We describe a case of a phosphaturic mesenchymal tumour in the infratemporal fossa that caused oncogenic osteomalacia, resolved by means of surgical excision.
metadata.dc:title: Osteomalacia oncogénica por tumor mesenquimal fosfatúrico en fosa infratemporal.
[Oncogenic osteomalacia due to phosphaturic mesenchymal tumour in infratemporal fossa].
